result.execSummary:
The defendant John N Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: Count 2.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA sample and surcharge are waived.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Defedant to contact Probation and Parole by 09:00 a.m. on 06-14-2016.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John N Hernandez in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to both counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 1& 2.
Court 3 is dismissed as a read in.


Court orders the following:
Count 1:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  12 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent to:  count 2.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
Not to operate a motor vehicle without being properly licensed.
Defendant to contact Probation by 9 am. tomorrow (06/14/16).

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  

  



Count 2:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  12 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent to:  count 1.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 1.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
